data.text:
@realdarrellvann @CNN @MSNBC Pro tip:  Assumptions are dangerous.
The wildfires are NOT in my state. But they are in my COUNTRY.
It is S.O.P. for presidents to send their concern and support in times of tragedy.
Until now.
Meanwhile, might want to inform yourself about the cause/severity of the fires.

@HoffmanHopes @CNN @MSNBC While I hate hearing about the strife and turmoil the wildfires are bringing to your area, some of it is fate and can’t be avoided. Some of the severity is manageable from a human standpoint with common sense. Still we all party for y’all and your well being.

@HoffmanHopes @CNN @MSNBC @POTUS Odds are the President has made a statement about your complaints and you’ve missed it. I’ve seen this happen repeatedly to him, being blamed for such by his detractors only to learn that it was all about political rhetoric.

@realdarrellvann @CNN @MSNBC Interested in knowing why the president has not uttered a word of "thoughts and prayers" for such a major national disaster.
If you think that silence is appropriate -- whatever your partisan persuasion -- God help you if your state is ever beset with such a tragedy.

@HoffmanHopes @CNN @MSNBC It happens. There are reasons for it . Some valid, others simply rhetoric. 
Given the mostly partisan hyperbolic nature of most of your TL I believe your simply seeking to bait rather than debate. Go fish elsewhere.
